Package com.dacubeking.AutoBuilder.robot.annotations

Annotation Interface RequireWait

@Retention(RUNTIME) @Target({TYPE,METHOD,FIELD}) public @interface RequireWait
This annotation should be used on methods/commands that the AutoBuilder should wait for to finish before continuing.

When using this annotation, the AutoBuilder will wait for the command/method to finish before continuing.

- For Commands: This means the command will be submitted to the scheduler, and the AutoBuilder will wait until the command finishes before continuing. The AutoBuilder will wait until Command#isScheduled returns false for the command.

- For other methods: This means the AutoBuilder will wait until the method returns true before continuing.

If a method is not annotated with this annotation, the AutoBuilder will not check if it's finished before continuing.

- For Commands: This means the command will be submitted to the scheduler, but the AutoBuilder will not wait for it to finish. The CommandScheduler will run the command in the background.

- For other methods: This means the AutoBuilder will not check if the method returns true before continuing. Only one iteration of the method will be run.

NOTE: Only annotate classes/fields that are commands with this annotation. If the class is not a command, the annotation will be ignored. Only methods that you're intending to run from the AutoBuilder should be annotated with this annotation. Don't annotate methods that return commands, as the AutoBuilder will not pick up the annotation. (Instead, save the returned command to a field, and annotate the field with this annotation and AutoBuilderAccessible).

Example Use Case:

You have a shoot command/method, and you want to wait until the shooter shoots before continuing. You can annotate the shoot command with this annotation, and the AutoBuilder will wait until the shooter is done shooting before continuing.
